title: Ayub Khan (general)
summary: Field Marshal Muhammad Ayub Khan  (Urdu: محمد ایوب خان‎; 14 May 1907 – 19 April 1974), was the second president of Pakistan. He was an army general who seized the presidency from Iskander Mirza in a coup in 1958, the first successful coup d'état in the country. Popular demonstrations and labour strikes supported by the protests in East Pakistan ultimately led to his forced resignation in 1969.
